intro: Campuloclinium urticifolium, commonly known as the stinging nettleleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive stinging hair structure, similar to true nettles. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, oval fruits that contain seeds. Botanically, it belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes other flowering plants with similar ecological and morphological traits.
